title: Home page: Lighthouse performance, accessibility, best practices and SEO scores
description: Run Lighthouse on the Home page and verify Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices and SEO scores are >= 90.

steps.description: Open the Home page (/) in a clean production-like environment (no devtools throttles except network/CPU as in CI).
Run an automated Lighthouse audit (simulate mobile and desktop runs).
Assert Lighthouse Performance >= 90.
Assert Lighthouse Accessibility >= 90.
Assert Lighthouse Best Practices >= 90.
Assert Lighthouse SEO >= 90.

title: Responsive layout across common breakpoints
description: Verify layout and navigation render correctly at 320px, 375px, 768px, 1024px and 1440px widths on key pages (Home, Projects, Experience).

steps.description: Open Home page and resize viewport to 320px width.
Assert header, hero, and primary CTAs are visible and not overlapping; mobile menu toggle is present if applicable.
Repeat for widths 375px, 768px, 1024px and 1440px on Home, Projects, and Experience pages.
Assert grids, timelines and project cards reflow appropriately at each breakpoint and no horizontal scroll appears.

title: Accessibility: automated axe-core scan and keyboard navigation
description: Run automated accessibility checks and manually test keyboard-only navigation and ARIA attributes for core pages and components.

steps.description: Run an axe-core scan on Home, Projects, Experience and Admin pages.
Assert no critical or serious accessibility violations are reported.
Using keyboard only (Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Space), navigate header, hero CTA, project cards, contact form fields and admin form controls.
Assert logical tab order, focus indicators visible, and interactive elements operable by keyboard.

title: SEO: meta tags, OpenGraph, Twitter Cards, and JSON-LD on Home
description: Verify the Home page contains correct title, description, OpenGraph and Twitter meta tags and valid Schema.org JSON-LD.

steps.description: Open Home page HTML and inspect head meta tags.
Assert <title> and meta description match expected content and are not empty.
Assert OpenGraph tags (og:title, og:description, og:image, og:url) and Twitter card tags are present and contain valid values.
Assert a Schema.org JSON-LD block is present and validates against schema expectations (site, person, breadcrumbs or portfolio schema).

title: 404 page for unknown routes
description: Verify unknown routes return the custom 404 page with navigation back to home and correct HTTP status code.

steps.description: Navigate to a non-existent route, e.g., /non-existent-path-xyz.
Assert the custom 404 page content is displayed and contains a link or button to navigate back to Home.
Assert the HTTP response status code is 404.

title: Header navigation and mobile menu toggle behavior
description: Verify header navigation links work, sticky behavior (if any), and mobile hamburger toggles the menu and closes appropriately.

steps.description: Open page at desktop width and click header navigation items (About, Projects, Experience, Contact).
Assert each click navigates/scrolls to the correct section or page.
Resize to mobile width and click the mobile menu toggle (hamburger).
Assert the mobile navigation opens, displays links, and closes when a link is selected or when toggle is clicked again.

title: Hero: typing effect presence and CTA scroll behavior
description: Verify the typewriter effect runs and CTA button scrolls to About section smoothly.

steps.description: Open Home page and observe hero area for presence of typing/typewriter effect text.
Assert typing effect cycles through expected strings and does not block content visibility.
Click the hero CTA that should navigate/scroll to About section.
Assert the viewport scrolls to About section and focus is placed on an appropriate heading or element.

title: Projects page: category filtering and result correctness
description: Verify project filtering by category/tag updates the displayed project list accurately and filter states persist across navigation where intended.

steps.description: Open /projects page and note the full unfiltered list of project cards.
Select a category filter (e.g., 'Web', 'Mobile', 'Open Source').
Assert only projects matching the selected category are visible and others are hidden.
Combine multiple filters (if supported) or clear filters.
Assert combined filter results are correct and clearing restores the full list.

title: Project card: open details and external link attributes
description: Verify clicking a project card opens the detail view (internal) or external demo/repo link opens in a new tab with proper target/rel attributes.

steps.description: On /projects, click a project card that has an internal detail page.
Assert the project detail view opens and displays title, description, technologies and links.
Click an external demo or source link for a project (if available).
Assert the link opens in a new tab and the link element includes target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer" (or equivalent).

title: Contact form client-side validation
description: Verify contact form prevents submission with invalid or missing inputs and displays appropriate validation messages.

steps.description: Open the Contact form and attempt to submit with all fields empty.
Assert validation messages are shown for required fields and the form is not submitted.
Enter an invalid email address and valid content in other fields, then submit.
Assert an email validation error is shown and submission is blocked until a valid email is provided.

title: Contact form: successful submission and success UX
description: Verify valid contact form submission posts to backend/email endpoint, displays success toast, and optionally stores message in Supabase.

steps.description: Fill contact form with valid name, email, subject and message.
Submit the form.
Assert a success toast or confirmation message appears indicating the message was sent.
If the environment supports message storage in Supabase, query the messages table and assert a new record with matching subject and email exists.

title: Contact form: backend failure handling and retry UX
description: Simulate backend failure for contact form submission and verify user sees meaningful error messaging and ability to retry.

steps.description: Stub or configure the contact API to return a 500 error on submission.
Fill contact form with valid data and submit.
Assert an error toast or message is displayed explaining the failure and suggesting a retry or alternative contact method.
Attempt to submit again once service is restored.
Assert successful submission behavior after retry.

title: Admin: unauthenticated access redirects to login
description: Verify visiting /admin when unauthenticated redirects or prompts for Supabase Auth login and prevents access to dashboard content.

steps.description: Open /admin in a browser session with no authentication cookies or tokens.
Assert the user is redirected to a login screen or sees a login prompt and cannot access admin dashboard content.

title: Admin: email/password login and session enforcement
description: Verify an admin can authenticate with Supabase email/password, a session is established, and protected admin routes are accessible only while session is valid.

steps.description: On the admin login page, enter valid admin email and password and submit.
Assert authentication succeeds and the user is redirected to the admin dashboard.
Navigate to an admin-only page (e.g., /admin/projects) with the session active.
Assert the page loads and allows management actions.
Invalidate the session (log out or remove token) and attempt to access the same admin route.
Assert access is denied and the user is redirected to login.

title: Admin: create, edit and delete Project entries (without image upload)
description: Verify Projects CRUD operations via the Admin Dashboard work with metadata fields (title, description, tags, links) and changes reflect immediately on the public Projects page; skip image upload testing.

steps.description: Log in to Admin Dashboard and navigate to Projects management.
Create a new project with title, description, tags and demo/source URLs (use a placeholder image URL if image field is required).
Assert the create action returns success and the new project appears in admin list.
Open the public /projects page and assert the new project is visible in the list with provided metadata.
Edit the project's title and save changes.
Assert edits persist in admin and on the public Projects page immediately.
Delete the project from the admin dashboard.
Assert the project is removed from admin list and no longer appears on the public site.

title: Admin: create, edit and delete Skills and their public reflection
description: Verify Skills CRUD workflow in Admin Dashboard and that skill cards reflect changes on public site (title, category, proficiency).

steps.description: Log in to Admin Dashboard and navigate to Skills management.
Create a new skill with name, category and proficiency level.
Assert the skill appears in admin list and on public Skills section with correct data.
Edit the skill proficiency and save.
Assert the updated proficiency is shown on the public Skills section.
Delete the skill.
Assert the skill is removed from both admin and public pages.

title: Admin: create, edit and delete Education entries
description: Verify CRUD for Education timeline entries in Admin Dashboard and reflect updates on public Experience/Education displays.

steps.description: Log in and navigate to Education management in the admin dashboard.
Create a new education entry with institution, degree, dates and description.
Assert the new education entry appears on the public Education timeline with correct order and content.
Edit the entry's dates and save.
Assert changes are reflected immediately on the public timeline.
Delete the entry.
Assert the entry is removed from public view.

title: Admin: create, edit and delete Experience timeline entries
description: Verify CRUD operations for Experience entries in the Admin Dashboard and that timeline displays maintain chronological ordering and content.

steps.description: Log in to Admin Dashboard and go to Experience management.
Create an experience entry with position, company, dates, location and description.
Assert the entry appears on the public Experience timeline with the correct position and company.
Edit the experience description and save.
Assert the updated description shows on the public site.
Delete the entry.
Assert it is removed from the public timeline and ordering of remaining items remains correct.

title: Supabase integration failure handling
description: Simulate Supabase downtime or failed API responses and verify UI displays appropriate error states and does not expose raw errors or break the application.

steps.description: Stub Supabase client calls to return network errors or 5xx responses for read and write operations.
Attempt to load public dynamic content (projects/skills) and perform an admin CRUD action (create/edit).
Assert the public pages show a user-friendly error state or fallback content and do not crash.
Assert the admin UI displays clear error messages and suggests retry, and no sensitive error stack traces or environment variables are exposed to the client.

title: PWA: service worker registration and manifest presence
description: Verify service worker registers, manifest.json exists and the site meets basic installability checks.

steps.description: Open Home page and check that navigator.serviceWorker registers the site's service worker (public/sw.js).
Assert the service worker is registered and active in the browser.
Fetch /manifest.json.
Assert manifest.json is present, valid JSON, and contains name, short_name, icons, start_url and display properties.
Assert the site passes basic installability checks (HTTPS, manifest, service worker controlling page).

title: SEO: Projects and Experience pages meta tags and JSON-LD
description: Verify Projects and Experience pages have appropriate title/description meta tags and valid structured data relevant to those pages.

steps.description: Open /projects and inspect head meta tags and any JSON-LD present.
Assert page title and meta description are present and meaningful for the Projects page and OpenGraph tags exist.
Open /experience and repeat the checks for Experience-specific meta tags and JSON-LD (e.g., timeline or person role information).
Assert JSON-LD validates for expected schema types and contains required fields.

title: Animations/UI effects degrade gracefully when JavaScript is disabled
description: Verify that critical content remains readable and navigable when animations or JS-based effects (particles, typed, tilt, scroll reveal) are not available.

steps.description: Disable JavaScript in the browser and open Home and Projects pages.
Assert content (hero text, skills, projects, experience) is visible, semantic HTML is present, and navigation works via normal links.
Assert no broken placeholders or missing core content due to absent JS-based effects.

title: Sitemap and robots.txt presence and validity
description: Verify sitemap.xml and robots.txt exist, are accessible, and reference the correct public pages and allowed/disallowed rules.

steps.description: Fetch /sitemap.xml and /robots.txt.
Assert both files return 200 and are well-formed (XML for sitemap, plain text for robots).
Assert sitemap contains key public URLs (/, /projects, /experience) and robots.txt does not block critical pages for crawlers.

title: Security: server-side route protection and no exposure of environment variables
description: Verify admin API endpoints require a valid Supabase session and that server-rendered pages do not expose environment variables or secrets in HTML or JS bundles.

steps.description: Attempt to call admin API endpoints (create/update/delete) without authentication token.
Assert API returns 401/403 and no changes occur.
Inspect public HTML and client-side JavaScript bundles for presence of environment variable values (e.g., Supabase keys) or secrets inlined.
Assert no environment secrets or sensitive values are present client-side.

title: Data integrity: immediate reflection of admin changes on public pages
description: Verify that after performing create/edit/delete in admin, public pages show updated data without manual cache clearing (within expected propagation time).

steps.description: Create or edit a public-facing record via admin (e.g., change a project title).
Open the public page that shows the record in a separate session and refresh the page.
Assert the change is visible on the public page within expected propagation time (immediate or within configured caching TTL).

title: Handling of broken or removed project links on public site
description: Verify that if a project is removed or its external link becomes unreachable, the public site shows appropriate messaging or fallbacks and does not crash.

steps.description: Remove a project via admin or update a project's external demo URL to an unreachable address.
On the public Projects page, click the project card or external link that was removed/changed.

If the project was deleted, assert the public site no longer lists it; if the external link is broken, assert the UI either disables the link, shows a warning, or gracefully handles the failed navigation (e.g., shows 404 on external resource attempt).

title: Keyboard focus order and ARIA attributes for interactive components
description: Verify focus order and ARIA attributes for header navigation, mobile menu, project filters, contact form and admin form controls to support screen reader users.

steps.description: Tab through header, open mobile menu, tab through menu items, and tab to project filters and contact form fields.
Assert focus moves in logical sequence and interactive elements expose ARIA labels/roles where appropriate (e.g., aria-expanded on toggles).
Inspect interactive components used in admin (forms, save/delete buttons) for ARIA and accessible names.
Assert admin controls are announced by assistive tech via accessible names and roles.

title: Images: presence of alt text for accessibility and reachable URLs
description: Verify that all images used across public pages include alt attributes and referenced image URLs are reachable (excluding testing file upload functionality).

steps.description: Crawl public pages and collect elements.
Assert each image has a non-empty alt attribute or appropriate role/aria-hidden when decorative.
Request the image src URLs and check HTTP response status.
Assert images referenced by src respond with 200 and return an image content-type.

title: Cross-browser compatibility for core flows
description: Verify core user flows (navigation, project filtering, contact form submission, admin login and CRUD) operate correctly on modern browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari and Edge (latest stable versions).

steps.description: Run the core flows (navigate site, filter projects, submit contact form, admin login and a simple CRUD operation) in Chrome, Firefox, Safari and Edge.
Assert flows complete successfully and UI elements are rendered correctly in each browser without JS errors.

title: Security: input sanitization for admin-created content to prevent XSS
description: Verify admin form inputs are sanitized and stored content does not execute injected scripts on public pages.

steps.description: In a secure test environment, create an admin record (e.g., project description) that contains typical XSS payloads (script tags, onerror attributes) in input fields.
Save the record and open the corresponding public page that renders that content.
Assert that no injected scripts execute in the browser (no alerts or console indications) and that the content is either escaped, sanitized, or stripped of executable markup.
Assert server-side validation or sanitization logs the event and the stored content is safe for rendering.
